Articles.Content: Do Kerbals play Human Space Program?
Yes, but its a really boring game where all your money goes to Kall of Duty instead of your ships.
Yes the kerbals love human space program they are playing right now
The most popular character of course would be Jeb Herman.
Yea, but Jeb had to go do some RL stuff, so Bob took over for a bit. He kinda sucks at it so Jebs space program went from lunar landings to being incapable of launching humans.
No revert flights, quicksaves, or quickloads allowed.

The Kermans do indeed play Human Space Program. However, just after landing on the Moon, the game's politicians politicize the space race, slash the budget to the bone to make it appear they are fiscally conservative, and the lunar base never happens. Then the Kermans get bored and play Kermanville instead.
Well jeb hasn't been playing his space program NASA for a while while bill is busy doing SpaceX and bob is playing around with his program called virgin galactic
In HSP, there is no sandbox mode, no quicksave/load, and no time warp. It sucks.
Humans are just in a really early alpha.Neither the Kerbals had quicksave,nor load or time warp.Just wait.

Humans are just in a really early alpha.Neither the Kerbals had quicksave,nor load or time warp.Just wait.

I just hope it doesn't break compatibility...
I heard HSP is pretty boring, no time warps. Even for Moon missions you have to leave the game running for a whole week.

I heard HSP is pretty boring, no time warps. Even for Moon missions you have to leave the game running for a whole week.

Well 1 human week is 4 kerbal weeks.
And, all the planets are SO HUGE! It takes FOREVER to go places!
Not trying to offend anyone, but this cracked me up...Now, only if this forum actually had working spoilers.

The next update actually includes a command pod with an onboard computer on which you can pass time playing Human Space Program.

And guess what: they get the same joy from watching our rockets explode as we do watching theirs.
weirdly, this thread reminded me of this...
They actually have lagrange points and a use for all the science equipments.

No revert flights, quicksaves, or quickloads allowed.

On the bright side, part count is a non-issue.
In the HSP tie-in game, Human Country Sim, the government allocates 0.5 percent of their budget on the HSP! Imagine that!
In a parallel universe do Kerbals wonder if Humans play Kerbal Space Program?
